p: Hematology examination includes CRP, D-dimer, lymphocyte count, and so on. CRP level can reflect the severity of inflammation, which has also been reported to be closely associated with the severity and prognosis of COVID-19. [ 64] Scholars have reported elevated CRP levels in most COVID-19 cases. [ 1, 65] Wang et al, [ 65] reported that patients with the severe disease showed an increase in D-dimer concentration and a progressively decrease in lymphocyte count.
